reasoning_of_region: The problem is purely textual and all necessary information is already in the user prompt.
problem_understanding: Linda and Bob conducted an experiment to compare the average time it takes for a snowboard to slide down a hill with and without a layer of wax. The question asks which of the given choices best describes the experiment's purpose.

known.name: experiment
known.note: Linda applied wax to the snowboard and timed the rides.

known.name: average time
known.note: Average time for rides with and without wax was calculated.

relations: Comparison of average times with and without wax.
constraints: The experiment alternates between using wax and not using wax.

options.label: A
options.text: Does Linda's snowboard slide down a hill in less time when it has a thin layer of wax or a thick layer of wax?

options.label: B
options.text: Does Linda's snowboard slide down a hill in less time when it has a layer of wax or when it does not have a layer of wax?

reasoning_of_task: The task is to identify which question the experiment is designed to answer based on the description provided.
problem_summary: Linda and Bob conducted an experiment to determine if a snowboard slides down a hill faster with or without a layer of wax. The task is to identify the correct question that the experiment answers.

knowns.name: experiment
knowns.note: Linda applied wax to the snowboard and timed the rides.

knowns.name: average time
knowns.note: Average time for rides with and without wax was calculated.

asks: Identify the question that the experiment can best answer.
constraints: The experiment alternates between using wax and not using wax.
